wikipedia_page.main: William Lloyd Roots (10 September 1911 – 14 August 1971) was a British Conservative politician.  He was elected as Member of Parliament (MP) for Kensington South at the 1959 general election, and served until his resignation in 1968.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1959 United Kingdom general election

response: The Kensington South by-election, 1968 by-election was held in the Kensington South constituency of the House of Commons of the United Kingdom on 14 March 1968. The election was to fill a vacancy in the seat formerly held by Conservative MP William Roots, who resigned from Parliament in 1968 due to ill health.
